title.title: Title
title.description: A title that will identify this model in the model selection dropdown

system_message.title: System Message
system_message.description: A system message that will always be followed by the LLM

context_length.title: Context Length
context_length.description: The maximum context length of the LLM in tokens, as counted by count_tokens.

unique_id.title: Unique Id
unique_id.description: The unique ID of the user.

model.title: Model
model.description: The name of the model to be used (e.g. gpt-4, codellama)

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

stop_tokens.title: Stop Tokens
stop_tokens.description: Tokens that will stop the completion.

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: Set the timeout for each request to the LLM. If you are running a local LLM that takes a while to respond, you might want to set this to avoid timeouts.

verify_ssl.title: Verify Ssl
verify_ssl.description: Whether to verify SSL certificates for requests.

ca_bundle_path.title: Ca Bundle Path
ca_bundle_path.description: Path to a custom CA bundle to use when making the HTTP request

proxy.title: Proxy
proxy.description: Proxy URL to use when making the HTTP request

prompt_templates.title: Prompt Templates
prompt_templates.description: A dictionary of prompt templates that can be used to customize the behavior of the LLM in certain situations. For example, set the "edit" key in order to change the prompt that is used for the /edit slash command. Each value in the dictionary is a string templated in mustache syntax, and filled in at runtime with the variables specific to the situation. See the documentation for more information.

api_key.title: Api Key
api_key.description: The API key for the LLM provider.

Models.title: Models
Models.description: Main class that holds the current model configuration

Policy.title: Policy
Policy.description: A rule that determines which step to take next

ContextItemId.title: ContextItemId
ContextItemId.description: A ContextItemId is a unique identifier for a ContextItem.

ContextItemDescription.title: ContextItemDescription
ContextItemDescription.description:
A ContextItemDescription is a description of a ContextItem that is displayed to the user when they type '@'.

The id can be used to retrieve the ContextItem from the ContextManager.

ContextItem.title: ContextItem
ContextItem.description: A ContextItem is a single item that is stored in the ContextManager.

ContextProvider.title: ContextProvider
ContextProvider.description:
The ContextProvider class is a plugin that lets you provide new information to the LLM by typing '@'.
When you type '@', the context provider will be asked to populate a list of options.
These options will be updated on each keystroke.
When you hit enter on an option, the context provider will add that item to the autopilot's list of context (which is all stored in the ContextManager object).

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the ContextProvider. This is what must be typed in the input to trigger the ContextProvider.

sdk.title: Sdk
sdk.description: The ContinueSDK instance accessible by the ContextProvider

display_title.title: Display Title
display_title.description: The display title of the ContextProvider shown in the dropdown menu

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the ContextProvider displayed in the dropdown menu

dynamic.title: Dynamic
dynamic.description: Indicates whether the ContextProvider is dynamic

requires_query.title: Requires Query
requires_query.description: Indicates whether the ContextProvider requires a query. For example, the SearchContextProvider requires you to type '@search <STRING_TO_SEARCH>'. This will change the behavior of the UI so that it can indicate the expectation for a query.

selected_items.title: Selected Items
selected_items.description: List of selected items in the ContextProvider

continuedev__core__config__ContinueConfi.title: ContinueConfig
continuedev__core__config__ContinueConfi.description: Continue can be deeply customized by editing the `ContinueConfig` object in `~/.continue/config.py` (`%userprofile%\.continue\config.py` for Windows) on your machine. This class is instantiated from the config file for every new session.

steps_on_startup.title: Steps On Startup
steps_on_startup.description: Steps that will be automatically run at the beginning of a new session

disallowed_steps.title: Disallowed Steps
disallowed_steps.description: Steps that are not allowed to be run, and will be skipped if attempted

allow_anonymous_telemetry.title: Allow Anonymous Telemetry
allow_anonymous_telemetry.description: If this field is set to True, we will collect anonymous telemetry as described in the documentation page on telemetry. If set to False, we will not collect any data.

models.title: Models
models.description: Configuration for the models used by Continue. Read more about how to configure models in the documentation.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: The temperature parameter for sampling from the LLM. Higher temperatures will result in more random output, while lower temperatures will result in more predictable output. This value ranges from 0 to 1.

custom_commands.title: Custom Commands
custom_commands.description: An array of custom commands that allow you to reuse prompts. Each has name, description, and prompt properties. When you enter /<name> in the text input, it will act as a shortcut to the prompt.

default.name: test
default.prompt: Write a comprehensive set of unit tests for the selected code. It should setup, run tests that check for correctness including important edge cases, and teardown. Ensure that the tests are complete and sophisticated. Give the tests just as chat output, don't edit any file.
default.description: This is an example custom command. Use /config to edit it and create more

slash_commands.title: Slash Commands
slash_commands.description: An array of slash commands that let you map custom Steps to a shortcut.

on_traceback.title: On Traceback
on_traceback.description: The step that will be run when a traceback is detected (when you use the shortcut cmd+shift+R)

system_message.title: System Message
system_message.description: A system message that will always be followed by the LLM

policy_override.title: Policy Override
policy_override.description: A Policy object that can be used to override the default behavior of Continue, for example in order to build custom agents that take multiple steps at a time.

context_providers.title: Context Providers
context_providers.description: A list of ContextProvider objects that can be used to provide context to the LLM by typing '@'. Read more about ContextProviders in the documentation.

user_token.title: User Token
user_token.description: An optional token to identify the user.

data_server_url.title: Data Server Url
data_server_url.description: The URL of the server where development data is sent. No data is sent unless a valid user token is provided.

disable_summaries.title: Disable Summaries
disable_summaries.description: If set to `True`, Continue will not generate summaries for each Step. This can be useful if you want to save on compute.
